result.execSummary:
The defendant Trayshawn T Norman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery with Threat of Force [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Restitution set at $0.
Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by applying bail on deposit.   Any bail on deposit to be returned to person who posted.  If there is a balance remaining after bail used to satisfy  the costs, surcharges and assessments, same to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment. 
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 238 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obtain/maintain employment unless it impacts receipt of SSI.
Obtain GED or HSED.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Mental health assessment and  cooperate with any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications in dosages prescribed by treating physician.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing.
No contact with: Tracy G., Montreal T., Tamara P., Lenora S-M., Monica B., Kristen W. and Alicia D.

Cooperate with agent.
Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program.
Attend parenting classes.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.

charges.descr: Armed Robbery with Threat of Force

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

Defendant Trayshawn T Norman in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Defendant Trayshawn T Norman in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  Additional statement by Tamiea M.  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 6 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 2 1/2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 1/2 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 238 days time served.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at $0 
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by applying bail on deposit.   Any bail on deposit to be returned to person who posted.  If there is a balance remaining after bail used to satisfy  the costs, surcharges and assessments, same to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment. 
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing
-Cooperate with agent
-Obtain/maintain employment unless it impacts receipt of SSI 
-Obtain GED or HSED
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Attend parenting classes
-Mental health assessment and  cooperate with any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications in dosages prescribed by treating physician
-No contact with Tracy G., Montreal T., Tamara P., Lenora S-M., Monica B., Kristen W. and Alicia D.  
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored. 

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
 Filed, Pretrial Credit sheet

Attorney Toran reports that he has been privately retained has received discovery materials from Attorney Awni Yasin.  The Court to allow Attorney Toran to substitute in as counsel of record; Attorney Yasin allowed to withdraw.  Defense requests to reschedule this matter for sentencing at this time.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Matter before the Court for Scheduling conference.  Attorney James Toran indicates that he has been privately retained to represent the defense.  Case adjourned to allow the defendant to be present to address substitution of counsel.  Motion hearing scheduled for April 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Awni M Yasin in court, defendant Trayshawn T Norman not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Status conference.  Attorney Yasin appears as successor counsel appointed by the public defender's office.  Defense needs to obtain discovery materials; status date selected.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Trayshawn T Norman in court with attorney Benjamin J Peirce.  Defendant Trayshawn T Norman in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Sentencing Hearing.  Parties in receipt of PSI report.  Statement made by defense as to PSI reports.  The state request that the court inquire of the defendant his position regarding guilty plea.  Sworn: defendant Trayshawn Norman.  The Court holds colloquy with the defendant as to his current posture regarding withdrawal of guilty plea.  The defendant does not wish to withdraw his plea.  Statement made by the state.  The Court reviews the criminal complaint with the defendant.  The defendant denies being present during charged offense.  The state does not wish to proceed to sentencing for reasons set forth on the record.  The defendant reiterates that he does not wish to withdraw his guilty plea.  Defense motion to withdraw heard and granted by the Court.  Case adjourned for  status of counsel.   Attorney Peirce to notify public defender's office of the need for successor counsel.  Status conference scheduled for March 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Discharge Report, received and filed.

Defendant Trayshawn T Norman in court. Attorney Benjamin J Peirce appears telephonically.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Sentencing hearing on today.  Defense counsel is unable to appear in person on today due to medical issue.  Justice Point report addressed with the parties (1 miss).  The state informs the court that the defendant refused to meet with psi writer for follow-up interview.  State motion for remand heard and granted by the Court.  New date selected by the parties.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Report, received and filed.

Defendant Trayshawn T Norman in court with attorney Patrick T. Earle.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case calendared for sentencing hearing this day.  Attorney Earle informs court that there has been a breakdown in communication that is irreconcilable. Defendant Trayshawn T Norman in court with attorney Patrick T. Earle.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Sentencing hearing.  Off the record (in chambers) discussion held with the parties at their request.   Defense request for adjournment granted by the court; no objection from the state.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Trayshawn T Norman in court with attorney Patrick T. Earle.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

AS TO COUNT 4:  The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.  The Court orders Presentence Investigation Report.  Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement and Order for PSI report.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint report, received and filed.
